seo.title: Local Legends & Folklore of the Amalfi Coast
seo.description: Popular tales from around the coast plus where to see their traces.

linkLabel: Local Legends & Folklore of the Amalfi Coast
intro: Dive into Amalfi Coast legends and lore that shape festivals, statues, and local sayings.

sections.title: Saint Andrew
body: Amalfi Cathedral houses relics of Saint Andrew; locals credit him with calming storms and safeguarding fishermen.
Every 27 June and 30 November processions carry the saint's statue through town with fireworks and brass bands.

sections.title: Sirens of Li Galli
body: Myth says Li Galli islands lured sailors with song; today, boat tours share the legend as you pass the private islets.
Listen for references to Parthenope and the sirens when visiting Naples—they link the regions' myths.

sections.title: Living traditions
body: Praiano's Luminaria and Positano's fishing blessings blend faith and folklore with candlelit rituals.
Handmade ceramic tiles often depict saints, lemons, or coastal legends—spot them on doorways and church steps.

tips: Check municipal event calendars for feast days so you can join respectful celebrations.
Carry a lightweight shawl; many events lead into church services where modest dress is appreciated.

faqs.q: Where do I hear traditional music?
a: Look for folk concerts in Atrani and Ravello during summer festivals; tourist offices post weekly schedules.
